movies.title: Shifting Sands
movies.plot: Marcia Grey is wrongly convicted on trumped-up evidence of a German. After serving her term, she rebuilds her life and marries well. The German then attempts to blackmail her into helping the German cause during WWI.
movies.simplePlot: Marcia Grey is wrongly convicted on trumped-up evidence of a German. After serving her term, she rebuilds her life and marries well. The German then attempts to blackmail her into helping ...

biography.bio: Gloria Swanson went to public schools in Chicago; Key West, Florida; and San Juan, Puerto Rico. Her film debut was as an extra in The Fable of Elvira and Farina and the Meal Ticket (1915). From the following year on, she had leading roles in pictures for Keystone, then a year with Triangle, and, in 1919, a contract with Cecil B. DeMille. DeMille transformed her from a typical Mack Sennett comedienne into a lively, provocative, even predatory, star. She collected husbands (e.g., the indigent Henri de la Falaise) and lovers (e.g., Joseph P. Kennedy, father of President John F. Kennedy). Kennedy produced her Queen Kelly (1929), directed by Erich von Stroheim (it was von Stroheim's copy of this film that Swanson was watching as Norma Desmond in Sunset Boulevard (1950) when she leaped into the projection beam shouting, "Have they forgotten what a star looks like? I'll be up there again, so help me!"--ironic in that the butler-projectionist was, again, von Stroheim). She survived the switch to talkies, even learning how to sing for Music in the Air (1934), but her kinds of films were over with by that time. She returned to the stage in the 1940s ("Reflected Glory," "Let us Be Gay," "A Goose for a Gander"). She was a clothes designer and artist; she founded Essence of Nature Cosmetics; and she made television appearances through the 1960s and 1970s, doing cameos and pushing health foods. She received Best Actress nominations for Sadie Thompson (1928), The Trespasser (1929) and Sunset Boulevard (1950).
biography.name: Gloria Swanson

biography.bio: Joe King was born on February 9, 1883 in Austin, Texas, USA as Joseph Sayers King. He was an actor and director, known for Shifting Sands (1918), Destry Rides Again (1939) and Bullets or Ballots (1936). He was married to Hazel Buckham. He died on April 11, 1951 in Woodland Hills, Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Joe King

biography.bio: Harvey Clark was born on October 4, 1885 in Chelsea, Boston, Massachusetts, USA as Harvey Thornton Clark. He was an actor, known for A Shriek in the Night (1933), Shifting Sands (1918) and Red-Headed Woman (1932). He died on July 19, 1938 in Hollywood, California, USA.
biography.name: Harvey Clark

biography.bio: Leone Carton is an actress, known for Shifting Sands (1918).
biography.name: Leone Carton

biography.bio: Lillian Langdon was born on November 25, 1860 in New Jersey, USA. She was an actress, known for Intolerance: Love's Struggle Throughout the Ages (1916), Daddy-Long-Legs (1919) and Shifting Sands (1918). She was married to Mr. Bolles. She died on February 8, 1943 in Santa Monica, California, USA.
biography.name: Lillian Langdon

biography.bio: Arthur Millett was born on April 21, 1874 in Pittsfield, Maine, USA as Arthur Nelson Millett. He was an actor, known for Winds of the Wasteland (1936), Shifting Sands (1918) and Hearts Up (1921). He was married to Neva Gerber. He died on February 24, 1952 in Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Arthur Millett

biography.bio: Myrtle Rishell was born on September 12, 1877 in Portland, Oregon, USA. She was an actress, known for Mr. Briggs Closes the House (1918), Mr. Miller Muddles Through (1918) and Nancy Comes Home (1918). She died on September 12, 1942 in Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Myrtle Rishell
